comments.body: Do you know the version? `BSD 2-Clause` or `BSD 3-Clause`?

I don't (the previous recipe states `modified BSD`)
@pavoljuhas do you know?

Modified BSD means 3-Clause. Assuming that Modified BSD is correct for the library.

ref: https://opensource.org/licenses/BSD-3-Clause

We use common [license text](https://github.com/diffpy/diffpy.structure/blob/master/LICENSE.txt) that was worked out by BNL intellectual-property office for the whole diffpy project.  As far as I can tell, it contains all clauses from 3-clause-BSD and is extended with BNL disclaimer and acknowledgment of sponsorship.  It also shows copyright statements for all third-party sources that are redistributed within diffpy project (not necessarily in this package).

I am not sure if this overall qualifies as "Modified BSD".
@CJ-Wright Can probably call this `license: BNL` and leave the `license_family: BSD`

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +39,43 @@about:
  home: https://github.com/diffpy/diffpy.structure
  license: BSD
  license_family: BSD
  license_file: LICENSE.txt

comments.body:
- I suggest to use distribution archive from pypi.io as it has the package metadata already built.
- please update to 1.3.5.

I was pulling from github because the pypi link was acting up
`url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz` 

->

`url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/d/diffpy.structure/diffpy.structure-1.3.5.tar.gz`

see: https://circleci.com/gh/CJ-Wright/staged-recipes/70?utm_campaign=vcs-integration-link&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=github-build-link

I see - the filename in the URL should have been `diffpy.Structure-1.3.5.tar.gz`.  I will make sure the tarball for the next release is all lowercase - hopefully PyPI sets this according to uploaded file and not from package name.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +10,14 @@  fn: {{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  url: https://github.com/diffpy/{{ name }}/archive/v{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: {{ sha256 }}

build:
